org.schwering.evi.core
Interface IModuleInfo

All Known Subinterfaces:
IButtonable, IConfigurable, ICustomButtonable, ICustomMenuable, IDemanding, IMenuable, IParameterizable, IURLHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
TestInfo
public interface IModuleInfo

ModuleInfoClass basis interface.

The implementing class must define a constructor that takes no arguments (the implicit default constructor).
Each ModuleInfoClass must implement this interface. The ModuleInfoClass provides the basical information for each module such as its appearance name or its version.

Every module needs a ModuleInfoClass and a ModuleClass. The latter must implement IModule. It provides the real functionality of the module and is something like the main class of the module.

A module developer will get in contact with this module when he writes his ModuleInfoClass. However, IModuleInfo objects do not appear publicly in a module's lifecycle later. The IModuleInfo is wrapped by ModuleContainer completely.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Christoph Schwering (mailto:schwering@gmail.com)
See Also:
ModuleLoader, ModuleContainer, ModuleFactory

Method Detail

newInstance

public IModule newInstance()
Must create a new instance of the ModuleClass.

Note: Never instantiate modules directly via their constructor(s) or via IModuleInfo.newInstance! Instead it is highly recommended to use the ModuleFactory class to create and dispose module instances.

Returns:
The newly created module instance as IModule.
See Also:
ModuleFactory.newInstance(ModuleContainer)

getModuleClass

public java.lang.Class getModuleClass()
Must return the Class representation of the ModuleClass.

Returns:
The Class representation of the ModuleClass.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Should return the appearance name of the module. If this method returns null, the module's id is used as appearance name instead.

Returns:
The appearance name of the module.

getVersion

public float getVersion()
Should return the module's version. This is not very important as long as no other module depends on this module and requires it in a specific version.

Returns:
The version as float, e.g. 1.0f.

getInfoURL

public java.lang.String getInfoURL()
The returned URL should point to a HTML file with information about the module. Tip: The method might simply return "about.html" if this file is added as resource to the module's JAR file!

Returns:
A URL as String that points to a information file in HTML format.
